items.title: Keep Serial Number
items.text1: Serial Number is important to get support in the warranty period. It's labeled on warranty and circuit board as S/N:xxx-xxx-xxx but digital backup is recommended.

items.title: High Temperature
items.text1: Some parts get heated up to 120 degree celcius (250 degree fahrenheit). Do not touch aluminium parts directly. Top of PCR tube is still host just after PCR process has ended.

items.title: High Current
items.text1: Peltier in kit supports up to 10 Ampere. Do not touch circuit board while using. Keep it away from water and any conductive materials.

items.title: Android needs App
items.text1: Supported OS versions are 4.1 (Jelly Baen) and later. For Android User : Please install

items.title: Opensource
items.text1: This is totally opensourced hardware under GNU General Public License v3.0. You can get everything (3D model, circuit diagram, sourcecode, laser cut data and so on) from

items.title: You have tools
items.text1: 2 phillips screwdrivers, straight driver, multi spanner and grease spatula are bundled inside plastic bag.

items.title: Hint
items.text1: Laser cut wood has face and tail. It will look good if you always choose face side (logo on front panel) to be shown even it's symmetric.

unbox.label: Unboxing
unbox.text1: Before assembly, take a breath and let's check that you have everything needed. If you find anything missed or broken,
unbox.text3: with seriall number in warranty period.

head: Kit Content
Detail
Count
body: Aluminium PCR tube holder. Thin wires of thermistor are especially FRAGILE. Handle with care.
Check printed circuit board is not damaged
Heatsink and thermal conductive grease are packed in one box

items.title: All Parts
items.text1: Screw Bag 1, Knob and these woods are needed.

head: Name
Detail
Count
body: Support heater to go up and down.
2 small holes for hinge and 1 bigger hole for calbes of heater

head: Name
Detail
Count
body: With 4 wires. Pink ones are thermistor inside.
Cover one side of heater to avoid convection
Plate with 4 holes on each corners

items.title: Floating Heater
items.text1: Peel off blue tape from aluminium plate and double-sided tape from heater. Glue heater to the midst of aluminium plate. Don't cover holes on corner.
items.text2: Screw 4 longer screws (M3 15mm) and nuts like this and put sponge on it.
items.text3: Peel off double-sided tape on sponge and cover the heater. Just put it if there's no double-sided tape.
items.text4: Screw heater lift wood with 4 nuts. Now heater unit is done.

items.title: Lid Base
items.text1: Assemble box with remained 4 screws and 4 spacers.
items.text2: Place heater unit inside and thread all 4 wires of heater through the hole of lid back wood.

items.title: Lid Cover
items.text1: Screw lid top wood with last 4 screws and put a knob. Now you have made lid.

items.title: All Parts
items.text1: Screw Bag 2, Well, Heatsink+SpareGrease and these woods are needed.

head: Name
Detail
Count
body: Wider area is front side (bottom in picture). Asymmetric : hole for cable (red circle) will come to the top-right when face side is up.

head: Name
Detail
Count
body: Use this first instead of spare grease in heatsink box.
High temperature durable silicon sealed peltier
To avoid airflow from body to lid

items.title: Woods
items.text1: Connect holders and top board with 4 thick screws (M5 20mm) and nuts. Both front sides (arrow) must be aligned.

items.title: Well
items.text1: Screw remained 4 thin screws (M3 6mm) and nuts loosely first.
items.text2: Turn well upside down. Tune directions of nus to fit the notches of heatsink holder and screw tightly. Confirm thermistor of well (red circle) is sticking to front side (arrow).

items.title: Peltier
items.text1: Pick up grease syringe from heatsink box and paste HALF of it over backside of well. Use spatula to smooth evenly.
items.text2: Align 2 wires of peltier over notchs of heatsink holder (arrows) and put peltier on well like this. DO NOT mistake red and black! That will break peltier easily.
items.text3: Thread thermistor sensors through peltier holder and connect it to heatsink holder with 2 thin-long screws (M3 15mm) and nuts. It's a bit difficult because heads of screws are downside. Confirm that thermistor wires of well are OVER peltier holder (red circle) and peltier wires are running through holes made by holders (arrows).

items.title: Aluminium Plate
items.text1: Smooth another half of grease over peltier as you have done before.
items.text2: Peel blue tape from aluminium plate. Put it over peltier and press a little.

items.title: Heatsink
items.text1: Hold white leg of heatsink in left hand. Rotate counterclockwise black cap and pull by right hand. Then it will be removed easily. Remove all 4 legs.
items.text2: Peel of cover sticker of heatsink and smooth grease. If there is no grease left, use spare grease.
items.text3: Screw heatsink with holders with remained 4 nuts (M5). Use multi spanner to screw tightly and confirm that there is no gap between heatsink and aluminium plate.

items.title: Fill Space
items.text1: Turn upside down and put sponge to fill the gap between well and top board using straight driver. No need to put it deeply because purpose of this sponge is not to warm well but avoid airflow from bottom body to lid. Just fill the gap.

items.title: Mount Lid
items.text1: Mount lid and thread 4 wires throught hole (arrow). Screw hinge on backside of the lid with 4 tapping screws. There are pilot holes.
items.text2: Screw bottom latch in front of lid with 2 tapping screws tightly. There are pilot holes too.
items.text3: Top latch is adjustable and lid should be closed firmly. Screw it with 2 tapping screws loosely first.
items.text4: Screw tightly while holding lid to top board.
items.text5: Check that you can open/close lid smoothly and firmly. Now you have made upper body.

items.title: All Parts
items.text1: Screw Bag 3, PCB, Fanguard, Rubber foot and these woods are needed.

head: Name
Detail
Count
body: PCB will be placed behind logo.

items.title: Bottom Wood
items.text1: Screw fanguard on TAIL of bottom board with 4 thick screws (M4 10mm) and nuts. Then face will be upside and it looks better.
items.text2: Connect 60mm and 30mm spacers to make 4 90mm spacers.
items.text3: Screw 4 rubber foot to bottom board with 4 thin long screws (M3 15mm) and spacers.
items.text4: Put all side boards except front.
items.text5: Mount upper body and pull cables out to front. Don't screw upper body yet.

items.title: Circuit Board
items.text1: Screw PCB on backside of front board with 4 thin long screws (M3 15mm), 4 spacers (M3 5mm) and nuts. Power connector should come to the right side of logo.

items.title: Wiring
items.text1: Connect longest heatsink cable to A. It wont be locked in wrong direction.
items.text2: Connect 2 power cables of heater (white) to B. No matter which white cable to be right or left but DO NOT connect pink cables. It will break thermistor.
items.text3: Connect 2 thermistor calbes of heater (pink) to C. No matter which is right or left.
items.text4: Connect RED cable of peltier to D1. DO NOT connect wrongly. That will break peltier.
items.text6: Wires of well thermistor are short and fragile. We connect it to PCB on next paragraph.

items.title: Well thermistor
items.text1: Last but most sensitive part of whole assembly process. Lift top/right/left boards a little and set front board.
items.text2: Lift up top board a little and connect well thermistor to E.
items.text3: Bak top board softly and screw it with remained 4 screws (M3 15mm).

parts.name: PCB
parts.note: Choose copper thickness as doubled (2oz) to support 10A or BURN

parts.name: ESP2
parts.note: Certified by Wi-Fi Alliance, SRRC, FCC, CE ( RED ), TELEC, IC & KCC

req.label: Hardware Requirements
